p: We are aware, however, that there is a lack of robust data about kratom efficacy in humans, to the best of our knowledge there is only one randomized controlled trial that would give some support to kratom's therapeutic potential in pain. Most of the information available today are the results of surveys and of retrospective studies, in which users claim Kratom's efficacy in treating acute and chronic pain of different etiologies ( 23, 24). Other conditions that appear to benefit from kratom are headache ( 24, 25), back, neck and muscle pain ( 24, 25), fibromyalgia, arthritis (including autoimmune ones like rheumatoid arthritis), autoimmune disorders like multiple sclerosis ( 13, 25), and other severe conditions like cancer and chronic inflammatory diseases ( 25).
